About
About
As a data science and bioinformatics leader passionate about making societal impacts, I have dedicated my career to using data to drive meaningful change. My work at Juno Diagnostics and ResMed underscored the transformative power of data in healthcare, particularly in advancing health equity and enhancing patient care.

A pivotal moment in my journey was participating in Terra.do's LFA program, which directed my expertise in AI/ML towards the critical field of Climate and Sustainability Tech. Now, as the founder of TerraMinds.ai, I am working as a fractional AI/ML tech lead for early-stage start-ups in biotech, healthcare, and climate tech, empowering them with innovative AI/ML solutions. This new chapter blends my experience and passion for technology with a commitment to creating a more sustainable future.

I am eager to collaborate with professionals who share a vision of leveraging data-driven innovation for a better world. Let's connect to explore opportunities for impactful collaboration in climate and sustainability.

I am eager to collaborate with professionals who share a vision of leveraging data-driven innovation for a better world. Let's connect to explore opportunities for impactful collaboration in the realm of climate and sustainability.

Post
Post
🌱 Exciting News on My New Venture in Climate Tech 🌍
In the last three months with Terra.do's LFA program (shout out to the Elephants🐘cohort!), I've embarked on an exhilarating journey through various fields of climate tech. My passion in AI/ML is now laser-focused on a new, vital mission: Climate and Sustainability Tech.

Why the shift from biotech, where I've built a strong network, to climate tech? Simple: I'm driven to harness innovative technologies for greater societal good. Throughout my career, my 'north star' has been using AI/ML to create a more equitable, sustainable world. Now, I'm thrilled to channel this expertise where it's urgently needed: combating climate change.

🚀 Introducing TerraMinds.ai: My Leap into Climate-focused AI/ML Consulting 🚀
I'm proud to announce the launch of TerraMinds.ai, a consultancy dedicated to empowering early-stage climate/sustainability tech startups with AI/ML solutions. My services include:
🤖 AI/ML Solution Implementation: Customized AI/ML solutions to drive your innovation forward.
🗺️ Project Scoping and Road-mapping: Strategic guidance for AI/ML project planning and execution.
🧠 Senior-level Mentorship: Expert mentorship to steer your AI/ML projects towards success.

Are you at the helm of an emerging climate tech startup? Do you have an idea that could flourish with AI/ML integration? Let's connect and explore how we can accelerate your impact for a better, sustainable future. 🌟

Post
Post
8 months ago, we launched a novel NIPS test that empowers women in health deserts through easy at-home collection and get accurate NIPS results without going to the doctor's office. Yesterday however we learned that we have become one of the startups that will dissolve in this wave of economy depression.

Together, in almost 2 years, we built state-of-the-art cloud infrastructures, bioinformatics algorithms, analysis pipelines that supported automated analysis of 5000+ samples within 8 months. Aside from this, we stood up the data infrastructures that enabled data visibility for the rest of the organization to pivot and respond to changes in the market. I am very proud with what we have achieved within this short amount of time.

If you're seeing this post and you're in need of any of the following talents for the specific positions. Please DM me as I have recommendations of great talents that just got back to the market now. I would work with these talents in a beat if I have a chance:
- Bioinformatics scientist: NGS analysis, algorithm development, statistics, machine learning
- Data scientist: specializing in production level machine learning modeling, deployment (MLOps), statistics, data visualization, data wrangling, data analytics
- Bioinformatics/Data Engineer: AWS cloud infrastructure, bioinformatics/ML pipeline engineering (MLOps), DevOps, Serverless ETL

Obviously, now I'm back into the market as well and would love to catch some coffee with anyone. ;)

I'm currently leading the Data Science team at Nucleix, a cancer diagnostics company based in Sorrento Valley, San Diego. We are looking to hire a Bioinformatics Data Scientist to join our team, with an ideal start date before September.
📍 Location: Hybrid (2–3 days onsite per week, San Diego)
 🎓 Qualifications:
 – Ph.D. in a relevant field with 0–5 years of industry experience (title/level will be determined during the interview process)
 – OR Master’s degree with 3+ years of biotech industry experience
🔍 Key Skills:
 – Machine learning and statistical modeling
 – Bioinformatics and NGS data analysis
 – Experience with cell-free DNA NGS analysis is a strong plus
This role is not yet publicly posted. If you or someone in your network may be a good fit, please feel free to reach out to me directly via DM. I'm happy to share more details. We'd love your help connecting with candidates passionate about building impactful technologies for early cancer detection.

August 4, 2023, Stephanie worked with Allison Chia-Yi but on different teams
August 4, 2023, Stephanie worked with Allison Chia-Yi but on different teams
I worked alongside Allison and the Data Science team she led for two years at Juno Diagnostics, and was thoroughly impressed with her commitment and leadership abilities. 

Allison's poise under pressure allows her to meet tight deadlines without compromising quality or enthusiasm. Her dedication to achieving the best possible outcomes for the team and the organization is truly inspiring. Allison consistently sought ways to help her peers by implementing process efficiencies and truly going above and beyond. 

As a head of function, she motivated her team and empowered them to support the marketing team and to learn new applications to data science. Their unwavering "behind the curtains" support contributed greatly to the marketing team's overall growth and success, although not always apparent to the rest of the organization.

July 29, 2023, Sara managed Allison Chia-Yi directly
July 29, 2023, Sara managed Allison Chia-Yi directly
I am delighted to write this glowing recommendation for Allison, who served as the exceptional Head of Data Science and Bioinformatics at Juno Diagnostics. Throughout her tenure with our company, Allison consistently demonstrated her extraordinary skills, leadership, and dedication, making her an invaluable asset to our team.

Allison's expertise in data science and bioinformatics is truly remarkable. Her in-depth understanding of cutting-edge technologies and her ability to analyze complex biological data have significantly contributed to the success of numerous critical projects at Juno Diagnostics. She possesses an uncanny ability to extract meaningful insights from vast and intricate datasets, which has played a pivotal role in advancing our research and development initiatives.

Beyond her technical prowess, Allison is an exceptional leader and team player. Her strong communication skills and approachable demeanor have fostered a collaborative and positive work environment. She has an innate talent for inspiring her colleagues, motivating them to perform at their best, and nurturing their professional growth. Under her guidance, the data science and bioinformatics team flourished, consistently delivering high-quality results and achieving project milestones ahead of schedule.

One of the most outstanding qualities of Allison is her unwavering commitment to excellence. She is not one to settle for mediocrity; rather, she consistently pushes herself and her team to strive for greatness. Her tireless work ethic and attention to detail have set the standard for the entire company, inspiring others to pursue excellence in their respective roles.

Moreover, Allison's innovative thinking and ability to approach challenges from different angles have been instrumental in solving some of our most complex problems. Her strategic insights have played a crucial role in the development of new products and services, expanding Juno Diagnostics' offerings and positioning us as a frontrunner in the field.

Aside from her professional prowess, Allison is a pleasure to work with on a personal level. Her positive attitude and genuine care for her colleagues have created a warm and supportive atmosphere within the team. Her approachability and willingness to lend a helping hand have earned her the respect and admiration of everyone she interacts with.

In summary, I wholeheartedly endorse Allison for any endeavor she may pursue in the future. Her exceptional skills in data science and bioinformatics, coupled with her natural leadership abilities, make her an invaluable asset to any organization. It has been an honor and privilege to have Allison as a part of our team, and I have no doubt that she will continue to make a profound impact wherever she goes.

Publications
Publications
Enabling Scalable Data Science Pipeline with Mlflow at Thermo Fisher Scientific
Enabling Scalable Data Science Pipeline with Mlflow at Thermo Fisher Scientific
Spark Summit 2020 · Jun 26, 2020
Spark Summit 2020 · Jun 26, 2020
Show publication
Thermo Fisher Scientific has one of the most extensive product portfolios in the industry, ranging from reagents to capital instruments across customers in biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, academic, and more. The amount of data needed to construct a comprehensive view of customer needs is massive and in order to build a data science ecosystem capable in dealing with this amount of data, each step from data engineering, model development, and delivery in the ecosystem has to be scalable.

With scalability in mind, Thermo Fisher partnered up with Databricks to build an end-to-end data science pipeline with CI/CD standards, and further augmenting our capabilities through use of the latest technologies such as Mlflow, Spark ML, and Delta Lake. This talk is a summary of our journey from past to current state, as well as looking ahead to the future of our platform.

Key takeaways:

Utilizing big data for machine learning requires not just machine learning knowledge but also technical infrastructure to support continuous development, deployment and delivery for machine learning models.
How you can build a scalable data science pipeline with latest Databricks technologies.

This talk is a summary of our journey from past to current state, as well as looking ahead to the future of our platform. Key takeaways: Utilizing big data for machine learning requires not just machine learning knowledge but also technical infrastructure to support continuous development, deployment and delivery for machine learning models. Southern California Taiwanese Biotechnology Association
Southern California Taiwanese Biotechnology Association
President · Jul 2016 - Jul 2017
President · Jul 2016 - Jul 2017
SoCal Taiwanese Biotech Association is a non-profit organization established in 2016 by San Diego-based Taiwanese professionals in biology-related fields. As the President, my main job is to organize the annual symposium and local events to promote the local biotechnology community, provide the networking opportunity and exposure for small to medium-sized start-ups, and foster connections between large firms and small start-ups. We also strive to build a platform for experience sharing and to bridge between the local community with Taiwanese Biotechnology industry and local academic scene.

The annual symposium draws around 250 attendees, renowned speakers, VCs, government platforms from all over the states and Taiwan.

International Chair · Dec 2012 - Sep 2013
International Chair · Dec 2012 - Sep 2013
Associated with University of California, San Diego
Associated with University of California, San Diego
I continued to be involved in organizing AYRCOB in 2013 which took place in Tokyo, Japan. AYCOB has a bi-chair system that has one chair from the hosting country and another international chair from any other countries. As the international chairs and chair of program committee, I was responsible for organizing opinions of organizers from all 5 different countries, dealing with budget issue, negotiating with local committee members and arranging the conference program.
